page.title: 06Housing In and Around Chard.
page.content: Many of the former farm houses and cottages in the rural area have been sold and fewer people living in this part of the block are now employed in agriculture.There is a small council housing development dating from {1947 at{Bondfield Way}and named after Margaret Bondfield the first lady Cabinet Minister who was born and raised in Chard.Several terraces of small houses follow the line of Combe St which is itself on the old spring line.There is extensive private individual development of the Western slopes of Snowdon Hill. Recently there has been pressure on marginal farm land to N. of the town for estate development there and plans for more housing between{Glynswood}and {Bews Lane.}The{Sunnymead}complex was built by Yeovil D.C.to provide full time care for the elderly.
